depends_on.evidence: REQ-002 'capture response' requires REQ-001 'display question' to have occurred first
REQ-003 timeout handling depends on REQ-001 question display being active
REQ-004 cancellation handling depends on REQ-001 question display being active
REQ-007 'record decision' requires REQ-006 'display authorization request' first
REQ-008 authorization timeout depends on REQ-006 request being displayed
REQ-009 invalid response handling depends on REQ-006 request being displayed
REQ-013 server queuing requires REQ-012 server startup to be operational
REQ-014 terminal updates require REQ-012 server with interface to be running
REQ-014 queue status updates depend on REQ-013 queuing functionality
REQ-018 value validation requires REQ-017 prompts to have collected input first
REQ-019 file creation requires REQ-018 validation to have passed
REQ-020 configuration testing requires REQ-019 file creation to have succeeded

enables.evidence: REQ-012 server mode enables REQ-001 to work without direct command execution
REQ-012 server mode enables REQ-006 authorization to work remotely
REQ-012 server mode enables REQ-010 notifications to work remotely

refines.evidence: REQ-005 adds specific server unavailability failure mode to REQ-001 general question display
REQ-011 adds specific server unavailability failure mode to REQ-006 general authorization display
REQ-011 adds server unavailability failure mode to REQ-010 general notification display
REQ-015 specifies port conflict failure mode for REQ-012 general server startup
REQ-016 specifies permission denied failure mode for REQ-012 general server startup

journey_to_requirements.notes: Covers all success outcomes (display, capture, return) and failure outcomes (timeout, cancel, server down)
Covers authorization request display, decision recording, timeout, invalid response, and server failure
Covers notification display and server failure handling
Covers server startup, queuing, terminal updates, and startup failure modes
Covers configuration setup workflow from prompts through testing
Covers administrative configuration setup with validation and testing

gaps.message: Negative requirements (REQ-021 through REQ-028) are orphaned - they constrain positive requirements but have no explicit dependencies documented
gaps.suggested_action: Consider adding depends_on relationships from negative requirements to the positive requirements they constrain, or document these as global constraints

notes: All journeys have full coverage with both success and failure outcomes addressed
Server mode (REQ-012-016) enables remote operation for commands (REQ-001, 006, 010)
Configuration workflow (REQ-017-020) is fully sequential with proper validation dependencies
No conflicts or duplicates detected among requirements
Negative requirements provide important constraints but could benefit from explicit dependency mapping
